definition: to go with sb/to form companionships
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
partner/companion/comrade/associate/to accompany
to stay together (of a group)/to keep together

sentences.english: Walk with a friend or group of friends.
Do you mind to phase, go home.
sentences.chinese: 相问君心意，结伴归家乡。

sentences.english: I'll keep you company as far as the station.
Trip with other tourists:We rent a truck to get the destination. It is a good start.
sentences.chinese: 包车同行》和其他驴友结伴，一起包了辆货车出发。

sentences.english: One day, they explore a forest together.
sentences.chinese: 一天，他俩结伴去森林探险。

sentences.english: The five came up to a barn where they saw a white goose.
sentences.chinese: 牠们结伴一起来到谷仓，碰到了白鹅。

sentences.english: Finally, a travel companion can make the journey easier and safer.
sentences.chinese: 最后，结伴旅行可以让旅行更自在，而且更安全。

sentences.english: Economic disaster has coincided with political chaos.
sentences.chinese: 祸不单行，经济灾难与政治混乱结伴同行。

sentences.english: For safety sake, travel in pairs.
sentences.chinese: 第七，为了安全起见，请两人结伴同行。

sentences.english: In the forest in Arabia shall ye lodge, O ye travelling companies of Dedanim.
sentences.chinese: 底但结伴的客旅阿，你们必在亚拉伯的树林中住宿。

sentences.english: Are you travelling to New York, too? We can go together.
sentences.chinese: 你也去纽约吗？我们可结伴同行。

sentences.english: You should use the “buddy system” and never go places alone.
sentences.chinese: 小孩出门应结伴同行，绝不要单独出门。
梅森和杰克结伴一起前去索格斯。

sentences.english: GIO That sounds funny. Do you two hang out a lot and travel together some?
sentences.chinese: 听起来真的很有趣。你们两个经常一起结伴旅游？

sentences.english: A wolf and a jackal often went hunting together.
sentences.chinese: 狼和狈经常结伴去伤害牲畜。

sentences.english: People avoided him, but the dogs hung out with him.
sentences.chinese: 虽然人们都对他退避三舍，但是狗却乐于和他结伴。

definition: to stay together (of a group)/to keep together
travel with another/accompany another
to troop (of soldiers etc)/convoy
to agree (on a meeting place, date etc)/to reach agreement/to make an appointment
to go the same way
in groups of three or four (idiom)
to gather one's friends/to band together
to amuse oneself/to have fun/to go sightseeing/to take a stroll
to join up with sb/to become partner/to take meals regularly in cafeteria
in twos and threes
to stroll
playmate/travel companion
to go for an outing/to go on an excursion
to be on foot
to join hands/hand in hand
to go on a tour/to have an outing
